lines.gurmukhi: swDsMg gMg imil sRI gur swgr imly igAwn iDAwn prm inDwn ilv lIn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasang Gang Mili Sree Gur Saagar Milay , Giaan Dhiaan Param Nidhaan Liv Leen Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A Sikh ever in attendance of Satguru merges in the ocean-like True Guru through the Ganges-like holy congregation. He remains engrossed in the fountain-head of Cyan (knowledge) and contemplation.

lines.gurmukhi: crn kml mkrMd mDukr giq cMdRmw ckor gur iDAwn rs BIn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kamal Makarand Madhoukar Gati , Chandramaa Chakor Gur Dhiaan Ras Bheen Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A True Sikh remains absorbed and immersed in the holy dust of the True Guru like a bumble bee and longs for a glimpse of his Guru just as a moon bird experiences pangs of separation of his beloved moon.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq mukqwhl Ahwr hMs pRym prmwrQ ibml jl mIn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Moukataahal Ahaar Hansa , Praym Paramaarad Bimal Jal Meen Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Like a swan whose diet is pearls, a true Sikh relishes the pearl-like Naam as his life support. Like a fish, he swims in the cool, clean and comforting waters of spirituality.

lines.gurmukhi: AMmiRq ktwC Amrwpd kiRpw kiRpwl kmlw klpqr kwmDynwDIn hY ]97]
lines.transliteration_english: Anmrit Kataachh Amaraapad Kripaa Kripaala , Kamalaa Kalapatar Kaamadhaynaadheen Hai ?97?

Shabad OS B.translation: By the element and nectar-like glimpse of grace of the True Guru, a true Sikh attains immortality. And then all mythical donors like Kamdhen cow or Kalap brichh and even Lakshmi (Goddess of wealth) serve him diligently. (97)
